    CommonMark
    • Preview
    • Source
    • Add Strong to text by clicking or by using Control plus B inside the text area.
    • Add Emphasis to text by clicking or by using Control plus I inside the text area.
    • Add a Hyperlink by clicking or by using Control plus L inside the text area.
    • Add a Blockquote by clicking or by using Control plus Q inside the text area
    • Add a Code Sample by clicking or by using Control plus K inside the text area.
    • Click to add an Attachment.
    • Add an Image by clicking or by using Control plus G inside the text area.
    • Add a Numbered List by clicking or by using Control plus O inside the text area.
    • Add a Bulleted List by clicking or by using Control plus U inside the text area.
    • Add a Heading to text by clicking or by using Control plus H inside the text area.
    • Add a Horizontal Rule to text by clicking or by using Control plus R inside the text area.
    • Click to Undo or use Control plus Z inside the text area.
    • Click to Redo or use Control plus Y inside the text area.
    • Markdown Help. This will redirect you to a new tab.
    Tab to the formatting toolbar with Alt/Option + F10.
    Hint: Notify or tag a user in this post by typing @username.

    Up to 20 attachments (including images) can be used with a maximum of 3.0 MiB each and 60.0 MiB total.

    If no cover image is uploaded or selected from the image gallery, then the default image for Feedback will be used.

    How to: Ask a good question

    Check for existing answers
    By referring to answered threads, your issue might be resolved without having to create a new thread which saves you a lot of time.

    Write a title that summarizes your question
    Summarize in your title your scenario and the technologies involved so the appropriate audience answer your question.

    Keep it clear and concise
    Other users will only be able to help you if you provide enough details and are clear about your question.

    Ask one question at a time
    Posting multiple questions on the same thread might not get you a response. Post additional or unrelated questions separetely.

    Use the right tag for your question
    Select the correct tags in your thread so your question to ensure your question is seen by the appropriate audience and get answered.

    Provide only feedback on Microsoft Q&A
    Keep your feedback specific to Microsoft Q&A. For other product feedback, keep engaging in your regular channels.
